      • getByteSizeNamesString

        Gets the String version of the type
        Parameters:
        whichOne - ByteSizeNames enum to be converted to a String
        Returns:

      • convertSize

        public static double convertSize(double bytesInput,
                                 FileUtilities.ByteSizeNames inputType,
                                 FileUtilities.ByteSizeNames outputType)
        Convert a byte type to a different byte type
        Parameters:
        bytesInput - Bytes being input for conversion
        inputType - the input type in the ByteSizeNames enum
        outputType - the output types in the ByteSizeNames enum
        Returns:
        A converted double. IE, send in 1024 kilobytes, get back 1 megabyte

      • convertToByteType

        public static double convertToByteType(double bytesSize,
                                       FileUtilities.ByteSizeNames whichToConvertTo)
        Converts bytes into the type you want. So you would pass in bytes and get back Megabytes (IE)
        Parameters:
        bytesSize - Bytes being converted. This is bytes, not kilobytes, megabytes, etc
        whichToConvertTo - of type enum BytesizeNames, convert output
        Returns:

      • convertToBytes

        public static double convertToBytes(double inputAmount,
                                    FileUtilities.ByteSizeNames inputType)
        Converts the input double into bytes
        Parameters:
        inputAmount - double amount. Could be 10, 544.44, 9999.99999
        inputType - The type being input, matches the ByteSizeNames enum
        Returns:
        Returns the double bytes after conversion

      • writeToFile

        public static java.lang.String writeToFile(java.lang.String path,
                                           java.lang.String data,
                                           java.lang.String nameOfFile)
        Writes a simple Text File (.txt)
        Parameters:
        path - the String path to write. If null, will use the downloads directory
        data - The string data to be written
        nameOfFile - name of the file String
        Returns:
        String location of file

      • getBytes

        public static byte[] getBytes(java.io.InputStream is)
        Converts an inputstream to a byte array (Mostly useful for sending images via JSON)
        Parameters:
        is - Input stream, if using a URI, open it by calling: InputStream iStream = context.getContentResolver().openInputStream(uri);
        Returns:
        Byte Array

      • logAndWrite

        public static <E> void logAndWrite(E myObject)
        Quick println in the logcat and write it to the file under downloads
        Type Parameters:
        E - Extends object
        Parameters:
        myObject - The string to print (or double, int, whatever)

      • writeToOutput

        public static <E> void writeToOutput(E myObject)
        Write data to a text file with data. The name of the file is debugLoggingData and its location is under the downloads section of the phone's memory (/storage/emulated/0/Download/). Maxes out at 5mb (which is enormous for a text file)
        Type Parameters:
        E - Extends Object
        Parameters:
        myObject - String to print

                            @NonNull

                     throws java.io.IOException
        Copy a file from one to another.
        Parameters:

        toFile - The to file that it will be copied to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws an IOException NOTE, if file paths are the same, it will not run

      • copyFile

        public static void copyFile(@NonNull
                            java.lang.String pathFrom,
                            @NonNull
                            java.lang.String pathTo)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Copy a file (Overloaded). Takes in String paths to use instead of files
        Parameters:
        pathFrom - From file path being copied
        pathTo - To File path being copied to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - NOTE, if file paths are the same, it will not run
